Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.4.12] [Workpapers]: The content on the page is getting truncated because of text spacing
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: People with low vision or dyslexia may override text spacing to enable readability or increased reading speed. Ensure that when users override text spacing via style sheet or another browser setting, there is no loss of content or functionality -- text must not be cut off or missing. When the content cannot adapt to user settings, users may not be able to use their preferred text spacing or may not be able to access content that is cut off or overlaps.

 

Link to screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/ovkuQLEbV2J5u

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=2896

 

Test Environment:

 

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Apply Text spacing Bookmarklet.

Step 6: Verify whether the Content Gets Cut off.

 

Actual Result:

Sign off Button and some Text on the page gets Cut off after applying text spacing.

 

Expected result:

All the content on the page should be visible clearly even after applying text spacing.
Repro Steps:

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [2.4.1] [Workpapers]: Skip Links are not defined on the page.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: User who is blind using a screen reader or a keyboard-only user. Each time the user accesses a new page in a site with a top navigation bar, the user would be forced to navigate past e.g. tab through all of these navigation links (and other content) before getting to the main content area of the page. This makes it difficult to access the page's main/unique information efficiently.

 

Link to screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/TdO92x2JIUU4Q

 

Reference:

https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=345

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Verify whether the skip links are provided in page or not.

 

Actual Result:

Skip Links are not present on the page.

 

Expected result:

page also has a set of section navigation links ("contextual links," typically to the left of the main content area), the skip link's target should be past those as well. In short, the skip link should be the first active element (displayed or not) in the page, and its target should be at the beginning of the main content area.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [2.4.7] [Workpapers]: Focus is not visible for buttons.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: Blind user will find difficulty if the visual focus is not provided for the content present in the page.

 

Link to screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/P27g6LssOuRzG

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=1249

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 6: Verify whether the visual focus is provided for all the content present on the page.

 

Actual Result:

Focus is not visible for add, Manage, create report, Confirmation, refresh, checkpoint engage.

 

Expected result:

Focus should be visible for all the content present in the page.

Note:

1. Similar issue is found in journal entry and trial balance

https://app.screencast.com/WxjktfsmAAehP

https://app.screencast.com/OGHtj3DyqjnP8

 

2. Navigate to add button-> select workpapers->add work papers dialog will be displayed-> select Go file room-> Go file room page will be displayed.

https://app.screencast.com/wOX0ne8FFeEqt

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [2.1.1] [Workpapers]: Tooltip information is not visible once the keyboard focuses triggers.
Description:

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [4.1.2] [Workpapers]: Ensures buttons have discernible text
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: User who relay on keyboard will find difficulty if the screen reader is not announcing the name of the Button.

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/0HT9SJeXgLcyP

   

Reference:  https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=602

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA.

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate to using the tab key.

Step 6: Verify whether the screen reader is narrating the name of the button.

 

Actual Result:

Screen reader is not announcing the name of the button for sign off, edit, View button.

 

Expected Result:

NVDA should announce the name of the button.

Ex: NVDA should announce it as Signoff button.

Note: Visual Focus indicator should be provided for button.

 

Other Instance:  

  1. Same issue is observed in trail balance page NVDA is not announcing the name of the Filter button.

            Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/3P8fmJPnS6o1V

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: Form inputs do not have properly associated labels in reports section.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: Radio buttons are intended to provide an ability to choose one (and only one) item from a group of related options. For this reason, radio buttons must be grouped properly for assistive technology to identify them correctly. To do so, content providers should supply identical values for the name attributes for all options in a radio button group. Further, unrelated radio buttons (that is, radio buttons which are not part of the same group) should not have the same value within name attributes.

 

Link to screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/zi0IvSLIUCY11

 

Reference:

https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=802

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 6: Click on View Button.

Step 7: User Preference dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Turn on NVDA Verify whether the Radio Button and check Box are Grouped properly.

 

 

Actual Result:

Check Box and Radio Button are not grouped properly.

NVDA is narrating it as Checkbox are not checked.

 

Expected result:

Checkbox and radio button should be grouped.

Ex: NVDA should narrate it as I have read the license agreement and terms and condition checkbox are not checked.

 

Other Instance:

Navigate using the tab key Click on Create report Button and select trial balance-> trial balance Report option page will be displayed Navigate using the tab key. Check whether the radio buttons are grouped or not.

Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/8vvZsssGjySJq
Repro Steps:
Summary: Checkbox and radio buttons do not have a properly associated labels in two spots. Checkbox in the 'User preferences' dialogue and radio buttons in the "Trial Balance Report Options."

Screenshot for checkbox: https://app.screencast.com/zi0IvSLIUCY11

Screenshot for radio buttons: https://app.screencast.com/8vvZsssGjySJq

Reference:
https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=802
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps for checkbox:
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.
Step 6: Click on View Button.
Step 7: User Preference dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Turn on NVDA Verify whether the Radio Button and check Box are Grouped properly.
 
Repro steps for radio buttons:
 Navigate using the tab key to Engagements< Create report Button. Select trial balance-> trial balance Report option page will be displayed Navigate using the tab key. Check whether the radio buttons are grouped or not.

Actual Result:
Check Box and Radio Button are not grouped properly.
NVDA is narrating it as Checkbox are not checked.
 
Expected result:
Checkbox and radio button should be grouped.
Ex: NVDA should narrate it as I have read the license agreement and terms and condition checkbox are not checked.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: NVDA is not announcing the label associated with the form Field.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: Users who rely on screen readers will find difficulty if the screen readers are not announcing the label associated with the Form Field.

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/SIrh6KdUl9xUE

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=341

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 6: Click on Sign off Button.

Step 7: Sign off Dialog will be displayed.

NVDA is not announcing the label associated with the form Field.
Ex: NVDA is announcing it as a Combo box required to enter to expand.
 
Expected Result:

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.4.11] [Workpapers]: Focus Indicator for datepicker doesn’t meet the required contrast ratio of 3:1
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: The user will find Difficulty if the Focus indicator does not meet the Minimum required contrast ratio

Link to screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/kqpHzDy9Ro5LN

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=2909

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 6: Click on Sign off button.

Step 7: Signoff Dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the tab key-> click on calendar icon.

Step 9: Calendar will get displayed.

Step 10: Verify whether the focus indicator of month and year meet the required contrast ratio of 3:1.

 

Actual Result:

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: Multiple H1 heading is defined on the page.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary:  The heading level of an element needs to match the level communicated visually by the heading on the page. Headings are used to communicate structure, relationship of sections, and describe the purpose of content. For example, in HTML, h2 elements should generally follow h1 elements, h3 elements should follow h2 elements, etc. Content authors should generally not "skip" levels (e.g. h1 directly to h3). When Multiple heading are H1 Heading are defined assistive technology may not understand the relationship of content.

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/tfyLv3iO7VXpJ

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=387

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 6: Click on Sign off Button.

Step 7: Sign off Dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the tab key-> click on delete button.

Step 9: Work properties page will be displayed.

Step 10: Step 6: Turn on NVDA, and select Insert+F7 to check headings.

Step 11: Verify whether the headings are defined properly or not.

 

Actual Result:

More than H1 headings are defined on the Quick compare chart page.

Expected Result:

Only one H1 heading should be defined on the page.
Repro Steps:
Summary:  Multiple H1's are defined on the Workpaper Properties page (when combined with the header menu). When Multiple heading are H1 Heading are defined assistive technology may not understand the relationship of content.
Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/tfyLv3iO7VXpJ
 
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=387
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.
Step 6: Click on Sign off Button.
Step 7: Sign off Dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the tab key-> click on delete button.
Step 9: Work properties page will be displayed.
Step 10: Step 6: Turn on NVDA, and select Insert+F7 to check headings.
Step 11: Verify whether the headings are defined properly or not.
 
Actual Result:
More than H1 headings are defined on the Quick compare chart page.
Expected Result:
Only one H1 heading should be defined on the page.

Step 6: Click on Sign off Button.

Step 7: Sign off Dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the tab key-> click on delete button.

Actual Result:

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate using the tab key.
Step 6: Click on Sign off Button.
Step 7: Sign off Dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the tab key-> click on delete button.
Step 9: Work properties page will be displayed.
Step 10: Turn on NVDA, navigate using the tab key.
Step 11: Verify whether the NVDA is announcing the correct role information.
 
Actual Result:

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: Nested table in Trial Balance filter dialog
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: Proper table structure allows screen readers and other assistive technologies to identify tables and allow navigation within them. When nested data tables are used within table rows, users of assistive technologies may have difficulty navigating between cells. In addition, users of assistive technologies may become confused about which table he or she is reviewing.

 

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/i0iyWZgz5o4aG

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=942

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate to the Trail balance tab.

Step 6: Navigate using the tab key-> activate the Filters button.

Step 7: Filters dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the arrow keys.

 

Actual Result:

Unnecessary table is being defined on the page.

NVDA is narrating the table and row information while navigating using the arrow keys.

 

Expected Result:

Unnecessary table should not be defined on the page.
Repro Steps:
Summary: The filter dialogue in trial balance has a list that functions like a table. As you access the filter in a table, this could be counted as a nested table. A much simpler, user-friendly option would be a select menu as the filter dialog functions as a form. 

Proper table structure allows screen readers and other assistive technologies to identify tables and allow navigation within them. When nested data tables are used within table rows, users of assistive technologies may have difficulty navigating between cells. In addition, users of assistive technologies may become confused about which table he or she is reviewing.
 
Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/i0iyWZgz5o4aG
 
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=942
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate to the Trail balance tab.
Step 6: Navigate using the tab key-> activate the Filters button.
Step 7: Filters dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the arrow keys.
 
Actual Result:
Unnecessary table is being defined on the page.
NVDA is narrating the table and row information while navigating using the arrow keys.
 
Expected Result:
Unnecessary table should not be defined on the page.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: Provide a valid label for form fields
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story


Summary: When on-screen labels are present, they must be programmatically associated with form fields. When on-screen labels are not present, form fields must be given an accessible label. When form fields do not have a programmatic (accessible) label, assistive technologies may incorrectly render the label or provide no label at all to users. When labels are not present or are incorrect, users of assistive technologies may not be able to complete a form.

 

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/BWbW4XOm2dMsX

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=338

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate to the Trail balance tab.

Step 6: Navigate using the tab key-> activate the Filters button.

Step 7: Filters dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Verify whether the visual label is provided for form fields.

 

Actual Result:

Visual Label is not provided for the form fields.

 

Expected Result:

Visual Label should be provided to for form fields.
Repro Steps:
Summary: Form fields in Trial Balance filter modal must have properly associated labels. 

When on-screen labels are present, they must be programmatically associated with form fields. When on-screen labels are not present, form fields must be given an accessible label. When form fields do not have a programmatic (accessible) label, assistive technologies may incorrectly render the label or provide no label at all to users. When labels are not present or are incorrect, users of assistive technologies may not be able to complete a form.
 
Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/BWbW4XOm2dMsX
 
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=338
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 5: Navigate to the Trial balance tab.
Step 6: Navigate using the tab key-> activate the Filters button.
Step 7: Filters dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Verify whether the visual label is provided for form fields.
 
Actual Result:
Visual Label is not provided for the form fields.
 
Expected Result:
Visual Label should be provided to for form fields.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [1.3.1] [Workpapers]: NVDA is not announcing the dialog Information.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [2.1.2] [Workpapers]: Ensure keyboard focus is not trapped
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: When a component can receive keyboard focus, the user must be able to use the keyboard to move away from the component using the keyboard. When this is not possible, keyboard only users including users who are blind or visually impaired and many users with mobility impairments will not be able to access other components on the page.

 

Link to screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/hCJ97oYjIUy6g

 

Reference:

https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=1243

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate to the journal entry.

Step 6: Journal entry page will be displayed.

Step 7: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 8: Verify whether the keyboard is getting trapped or not.

 

Actual Result:

Keyboard is getting trapped user is not able access the next interactive element on the page using tab key.

 

Expected Result:

User should be able to navigate to the page easily without getting keyboard trap.
Repro Steps:
Summary: When a component can receive keyboard focus, the user must be able to use the keyboard to move away from the component using the keyboard. When this is not possible, keyboard only users including users who are blind or visually impaired and many users with mobility impairments will not be able to access other components on the page.
 
Link to screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/hCJ97oYjIUy6g
 
Reference:
https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=1243
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate to the journal entry.
Step 6: Journal entry page will be displayed.
Step 7: Navigate using the tab key.
Step 8: Verify whether the keyboard is getting trapped or not.
 
Actual Result:
Keyboard is getting trapped user is not able access the next interactive element on the page using tab key.
 
Expected Result:
User should be able to navigate to the page easily without getting keyboard trap.

Provide a valid label name for check box.

NVDA is announcing as check box not checked.

Expected Result:

Valid label name should be provided for checkboxes.

Valid label name should be provided for checkboxes. Without a valid label, users will not know what they are checking the checkbox for.

Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/3XFFrV0QjTjf2

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Click on create workpapers.

Step 6: Select account grouping report type.

Step 7: Account grouping page will be displayed.

Step 8: Enter all the information and click on create report.

Step 9: Verify whether the NVDA is announcing the displayed page information or not.

 

 

Actual Result:

NVDA is not announcing the new page information displayed on the screen.

Expected Result:
NVDA should announce the new page information and page loading information without receiving the keyboard focus.
Repro Steps:
Summary: Users who rely on screen reader will face difficulty if the screen reader is not announcing the page loading information and page getting opened in a new tab.

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/3XFFrV0QjTjf2
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=2901

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Click on create workpapers.
Step 6: Select account grouping report type.
Step 7: Account grouping page will be displayed.
Step 8: Enter all the information and click on create report.
Step 9: Verify whether NVDA announcement orients you properly to the page content and whether you can hear the bread crumbs at the top of the page.
 
 
Actual Result:
Page title is not descriptive (says 'AdvanceFlow") and NVDA is not announcing the breadcrumbs at the top of the screen to give the user context.

Expected result:
NVDA should announce clear page information so the user understands that they've arrived at their report.

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [4.1.2] [Workpapers]: NVDA is not narrating the descriptive information for the buttons.
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary:

Users who rely on screen reader will face difficulty because NVDA is not narrating the descriptive information for the buttons.

 

Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/otsBXFNchRVqC

 

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=602

 

 

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Navigate to the trail balance.

Step 6: Trail Balance page will be displayed-> click on View and select Balance definition.

Step 7: Balance definition dialog will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the tab key.

Step 9: Verify whether NVDA is descriptive information for button or not

Actual Result:

NVDA is not narrating the descriptive information for the buttons.

Expected Result:

NVDA should narrate the descriptive information for the buttons.
Repro Steps:
Summary:
Users who rely on screen reader will face difficulty because several buttons in a row have the same accessible name. Navigating via interactive element will not be informative (the user will hear 'save' and not know what, exactly, they're saving). The purpose of each button should be clearly understood from its label. 
 
Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/otsBXFNchRVqC
 
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=602
 
 
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Navigate to the trail balance.
Step 6: Trail Balance page will be displayed-> click on View and select Balance definition.
Step 7: Balance definition dialog will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the tab key.
Step 9: Verify whether NVDA is descriptive information for button or not

Actual Result:
NVDA is not narrating the descriptive information for the buttons. You will hear "save, save, save" without any context.
Expected Result:
NVDA should narrate more descriptive information for the buttons (i.e. "Save asset", etc.)

Empty item should be removed from the list, NVDA should announce the empty lit item information.
Repro Steps:
Summary: List value information is not announcing when using arrow keys on the 'notes Report Options' combo boxes.

Link to Screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/Yr7uX0lsWd8NS
Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=393
Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Click on create workpapers.
Step 6: Select note report type.
Step 7: Note page will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the tab key. Expand the status menu button.
Step 9: Verify whether the NVDA is announcing list information properly.
 
 
Actual Result:
Empty list item is present in the status drop down, NVDA is not announcing the empty list item information to the screen reader user.
Expected Result:
Empty item should be removed from the list, NVDA should announce list information for existing options.

Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Summary: Account grouping check box, although accessible via keyboard, has no visible focus. This lack of visible focus makes it impossible for a keyboard only user to navigate.
 
Link to Screenshot: https://app.screencast.com/Hv1ruPA3smV9u  
 
[Reference] AMP Link: https://thomsonreuters.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=954

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com 
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148) 
  
Repro Steps 
  
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password. 
Step 2: Home page will appear. 
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab. 
Step 4: Select Add Drop-down from the Left navigation menu 
Step 5: Select Add Engagement from Drop-down and click on next  
Step 6: Go to Step 5 and navigate using the tab key  
Step 7: Observe that there is no visible focus.
 
Actual Result: While navigating using the tab key it is observed that there is no visible focus for interactive elements, so it is therefore impossible to navigate effectively using a keyboard.
 
Expected Result: Every interactive element should be accessible using the keyboard

Title: 508: [Cloud Audit Suite] [EPC] [4.1.2] [Workpapers]: Combo boxes throughout Workpapers 'Create Report' section are missing labels
Description:
Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story

Link to Screenshot:  https://app.screencast.com/Yr7uX0lsWd8NS

Reference: https://amp.levelaccess.net/public/standards/view_best_practice.php?violation_id=393

Test Environment:

URL: http://www.advanceflow.com

Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)

Screen Reader: NVDA

 

Repro Steps

 

Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.

Step 2: Home page will appear.

Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.

Step 4: Click on Workpapers.

Step 5: Click on create workpapers.

Step 6: Select note report type.

Step 7: Note page will be displayed.

Step 8: Navigate using the tab key. Expand the status menu button.

Step 9: Verify whether the NVDA is announcing the empty list information or not.

 

 

Actual Result:

Empty list item is present in the status drop down, NVDA is not announcing the empty list item information to the screen reader user.

Expected Result:
Empty item should be removed from the list, NVDA should announce the empty lit item information.
Repro Steps:
Summary: Combo boxes in 'Create Report' modal, 'Account Grouping Report Options,' 'Notes Report Options.' section do not have properly associated labels.

Location Screenshot: 




Screen reader experience screenshot:
(The user understands that there is a combo box, hears the combo box options but does not hear the combo box's label.)

Test Environment:
URL: http://www.advanceflow.com
Browser: Chrome (111.0.5563.148)
Screen Reader: NVDA
 
Repro Steps for example
 
Step 1: Open the URL In the chrome browser sign in with valid username and password.
Step 2: Home page will appear.
Step 3: Navigate to the Engagement tab.
Step 4: Click on Workpapers.
Step 5: Click on create workpapers.
Step 6: Select note report type.
Step 7: Note page will be displayed.
Step 8: Navigate using the tab key. Expand the status menu button.
Step 9: Verify whether NVDA is announcing the word "Status" 
 
 
Actual Result:
NVDA will announce that there is a combo box, list the combo box options but there is no indication of what the combo box is for. 

Expected Result:
Labels should be clear and programmatically associated with each combo box.

Title: [AF] [Communications] [Create Request] [508] not meeting reflow/magnification standard
Description:
As a low-vision user
I need the ability to magnify a website without loss of information or functionality, and without requiring scrolling in two dimensions
So that I can use websites effectively

Scenario:

For low-vision users, it's important to avoid scrolling to reveal lines that are cut off by the viewport. This kind of scrolling significantly increases the effort required to read. It's also important that content is not hidden off-screen. For example, zooming into a vertically scrolling page should not cause content to be hidden to one side. 

When using the browser to magnify the Communications tab to 400 percent (common sizes for low-vision users and the sizes being used to measure the success of WCAG 1.4.10) there is a loss of information and functionality. With 200% zoom, the UI is accessible to the user.

The issue exists on the 'Create request' page. Click 'Create request' on the communications page and then increase the browser zoom to 400%.

Precondition/UX: 

N/A

 
Dependencies: 

N/A


Risk/Unknowns:

Not meeting this standard will result in a compromised accessibility scorecard (which can impact our ability to sell products and run afoul of TR policy). Here's the TR accessibility policy.

Screenshot:

Title: [AF] [General] [508] Spike: Assess options to meet magnification and reflow standards
Description:
Objective(s)

The aim of the exercise is to come up with a feasible way to meet magnification and reflow standards in AdvanceFlow Engagements, so that:
  • When a user zooms in on a browser (<100% up to 400%), there should be no loss of content and functionality. 
  • The user shouldn't have to scroll in two dimensions. 
    • The exception in this instance would be data tables.
A good example of this issue is the Communications pane. 

Scenario/Context:

Users with low vision who need to make the content larger benefit when the layout adjusts. Research shows that horizontal scrolling significantly reduces reading comprehension. It is easier for people who enlarge text to read word-wrapped text line by line rather than scrolling back and forth across long lines of text. 
Currently, when using the browser to magnify the Communications tab to 200 and 400 percent (common sizes for low-vision users and the sizes being used to measure the success of WCAG 1.4.10), there is a loss of information, functionality and a need to scroll in two-dimensions. 

Precondition/UX: 

N/A

 
Dependencies: 

N/A


Risk/Unknowns:

Not meeting this standard will result in a compromised accessibility scorecard (which can impact our ability to sell products and runs afoul of TR policy). Here's the TR accessibility policy.

Title: [AF] [Communications] [Create Request] [508] Spike: Assess options to meet magnification and reflow standards
Description:
Objective(s)

The aim of the exercise is to come up with a feasible way to meet magnification and reflow standards in the Create Request portion of the Communications tab, so that 
  • When a user zooms in on a browser (<100% up to 400%), there should be no loss of content and functionality. 
  • The user shouldn't have to scroll in two dimensions. 
    • The exception in this instance would be data tables.

Scenario/Context:

Users with low vision, who need to make the content larger, benefit when the layout adjusts. Research shows that horizontal scrolling significantly reduces reading comprehension. It is easier for people who enlarge text to read word-wrapped text line by line rather than scrolling back and forth across long lines of text. 
Currently, when using the browser to magnify the Communications tab to 200 and 400 percent (common sizes for low-vision users and the sizes being used to measure the success of WCAG 1.4.10), there is a loss of information, functionality and a need to scroll in two-dimensions. 

Precondition/UX: 

N/A

 
Dependencies: 

N/A


Risk/Unknowns:

Not meeting this standard will result in a compromised accessibility scorecard (which can impact our ability to sell products and runs afoul of TR policy). Here's the TR accessibility policy.

(1.3.1, 4.1.2)

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that any text with meaningful text decoration (highlighting, strikethrough, insertion, bolding, emphasis, etc) is coded with the appropriate tags (<mark>, <del>, <ins>, <strong>, <em>, etc.) Note that most assistive technology will not announce bolding or italics in its default setting.

Expected Result

Semantic markup identifies emphasized or special text formatting. (1.3.1)

5. None

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that blockquotes are applied to visually blockquoted text

Expected Result

Blockquotes are identified as block quotes by the screen reader so that they are aware that this is quoted content (1.3.1) Blockquotes are not used for content that is not being quoted from another source (1.3.1)

6. None

User navigates pages with screen reader and verifies that any other information and relationships that are implied by visual formatting are available to the screen reader

Expected Result

Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text. (1.3.1)

Set the viewport width to 1280 CSS pixels wide and 1024 CSS pixels tall, and gradually increase page zoom up to 400%. Check page functionality and readability at each zoom increment between 100% and 400%. On complex sites, user may need to refresh, or browse to the page with resizing already applied, in order for the resizing to properly apply.

Expected Result

Content can be zoomed up to 400% without overlap, loss of functionality, or use of horizontal scrolling (tables and graphics excluded). (1.4.10) Do not truncate content vital to the understanding or meaning of the page unless there is an accessible way to view that content in full. (1.4.10)

Comments: 
Summary:
Users who rely on screen zooming will find difficulty because text is getting truncated and not visible,

Title: 508: [Journal Entries][1.4.3]: Contrast ratio is less than minimum required ratio 4.5:1 for the text.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.

5/19/2025 3:09 AM Bug filed on "Color - Text Contrast (1.4.3)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

Run an automated color contrast check in axe or another tool if you haven't already, and manually validate the automated tool results if necessary, by using the TPGi Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA) or a similar manual color picker. Some examples of text that may pass automated validation and require a manual review are placeholder text within fields, text overlayed on a background image or video, or text within read-only inputs. Disabled controls are exempt from color contrast requirements.

Expected Result

Small Text: Text smaller than 24px (18pt) meets at least 4.5:1 contrast against its background. (1.4.3) Large Text: Text at least 19px (14pt) bold or 24px (18pt) non-bold meets at least 3:1 contrast against its background (1.4.3)

Title: 508: [Journal Entries][2.4.3]: Focus is not moving in sequential order in the dialog while using TAB key.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.

Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5986393/JournalEntryV2

Test results:

5/19/2025 5:38 AM Bug filed on "Keyboard - Focus Order During Operation (2.4.3)"
Step no. Result Title
1. None

User interacts with any components that move the page viewport (e.g. activating a link to a footnote within the page)

Expected Result

Same-page links move both viewport and focus to the expected location. (2.4.3)

2. None

User interacts with any element that dynamically loads search results

Expected Result

For dynamically loaded search results, focus remains on the search control that initiated the search action. (2.4.3) For search results that populate on page reload, the focus resets to the top of the page.

3. Failed

User interacts with any components that trigger a dialog

Expected Result

When a dialog is opened, focus moves to a logical place within the dialog. (2.4.3) Visible and keyboard focus is constrained to open modal dialogs. (2.4.3) Visible and keyboard focus is not constrained to open non-modal dialogs. (2.4.3) When a dialog is dismissed, closed, or collapsed, focus moves back to the trigger control. (2.4.3)

Comments: 
Summary:
Users who rely on keyboard navigation will find difficulty because Focus is not moving in sequential order in the dialog while using TAB key.

Title: 508: [Journal Entries][1.4.10]: On resizing the page into 400% zoom table content not visible.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5986393/JournalEntryV2

Test results:

5/19/2025 6:40 AM Bug filed on "Responsive and Reflow - 400% Resize (1.4.10)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

Set the viewport width to 1280 CSS pixels wide and 1024 CSS pixels tall, and gradually increase page zoom up to 400%. Check page functionality and readability at each zoom increment between 100% and 400%. On complex sites, user may need to refresh, or browse to the page with resizing already applied, in order for the resizing to properly apply.

Expected Result

Content can be zoomed up to 400% without overlap, loss of functionality, or use of horizontal scrolling (tables and graphics excluded). (1.4.10) -Solutions must be considered for fixed/floating content on mobile views ("Pinned" or "Sticky" elements often overlaps/hides content at higher zoom levels and may need to scroll as a result) Information can be reorganized and user interface components can adapt at mobile breakpoints, provided information is not lost. (1.4.10) Do not truncate content vital to the understanding or meaning of the page unless there is an accessible way to view that content in full. (1.4.10)

Comments: 
Summary:
Users who rely on screen zooming will find difficulty because on resizing the page into 400% zoom table content is not visible and truncated.

Test Environment:
Browser: Chrome
URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5986393/JournalEntryV2

Pre-Requisite steps:
1.Open system settings->Display settings
2.Change the Display Resolution as 1280*1024
3. Change the Size of text as 100%(recommended)

Repro Steps:
1. Open the above URL in chrome browser using login valid credentials.
2. Engagement manager will be displayed.
3. Navigate to any link and click on it.
4. Navigate to Journal entries section using TAB key and click on it.
5. Navigate to Add entry link and click on it.
6. Add Journal entry page will be displayed.
7. Navigate to search button using TAB key.
8. Dialog will be displayed.
9. resize the page into 400% zoom.
10. verify whether the table content is not visible or not.

Actual Result:
On resizing the page into 400% zoom table content not visible.

Expected Result:
On resizing the page into 400% zoom table content should be visible.
Attachment(s):
Screenshot-2025-05-19T06-39-35.544Z.png
Test Configuration: Demo AF

Reference links:https://trten.sharepoint.com/sites/intr-digital-accessibility-coe/SitePages/Reflow.aspx

Title: 508: [Journal Entries][1.3.1]: List markup is not defined for the elements.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5986393/JournalEntryV2

Test results:

5/19/2025 7:44 AM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Information, Structure, and Relationship Information is Available (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates page with the screen reader and verifies that list information is either correctly identified by the screen reader or available in text.

Expected Result

Bullets or numbered lists are identified as lists either by the screen reader recognizing them or in the associated text. (1.3.1) Content that is clearly not part of a list is not falsely identified as one. (1.3.1) When a list has been programmatically defined, the screen reader announces the correct number of items in the list (1.3.1) List items that appear in columns are coded as one continuous list and only styled to appear in columns. (1.3.1)

Comments: 
Summary:
Users who rely on screen reader will find difficulty because list markup is not defined for the elements.

Test Environment:
Browser: Chrome
URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5986393/JournalEntryV2
Screen reader: NVDA

Repro Steps:
1. Open the above URL in chrome browser using login valid credentials.
2. Engagement manager will be displayed.
3. Navigate to any link and click on it.
4. Navigate to Journal entries section using TAB key and click on it.
5. Navigate to show new layout switch control and turn off the control.
6. Navigate to Add, delete, view history buttons using TAB key.
7. Verify whether the list markup is defined or not.

Actual Result:
List markup is not defined for the elements.

Expected Result:
List markup should be defined for the elements.
Attachment(s):
Screenshot-2025-05-19T07-44-21.629Z.png
2. None

User navigates page with the screen reader using its browse function (up and down arrows for NVDA) and verifies that the screen reader correctly identifies table and grid information

Expected Result

Data tables correctly identified as tables by the screen reader (1.3.1) Data grids are correctly identified as grids by the screen reader (1.3.1) Any HTML tables used for layout have role="presentation". (1.3.1) The number of rows and columns in the table or grid is accurately conveyed to screen reader users. (1.3.1) The screen reader announces cell content as well as the new column or row header associated to the cell. (1.3.1)

3. None

User navigates any sortable table or grid with the screen reader using its browse function (up and down arrows for NVDA) and verifies that the screen reader correctly identifies sort functionality and state

Expected Result

The sorting control is a semantic button, built with <button> element or role="button". (1.3.1) The current sorting state (unsorted, ascending, descending) is conveyed visually and within the code (aria-sort="ascending/descending" attribute applied to the sorted column <th> element). (1.3.1, 4.1.2)

4. None

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that any text with meaningful text decoration (highlighting, strikethrough, insertion, bolding, emphasis, etc) is coded with the appropriate tags (<mark>, <del>, <ins>, <strong>, <em>, etc.) Note that most assistive technology will not announce bolding or italics in its default setting.

Expected Result

Semantic markup identifies emphasized or special text formatting. (1.3.1)

5. None

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that blockquotes are applied to visually blockquoted text

Expected Result

Blockquotes are identified as block quotes by the screen reader so that they are aware that this is quoted content (1.3.1) Blockquotes are not used for content that is not being quoted from another source (1.3.1)

6. None

User navigates pages with screen reader and verifies that any other information and relationships that are implied by visual formatting are available to the screen reader

Expected Result

Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text. (1.3.1)

5/19/2025 8:19 AM Bug filed on "Color - Text Contrast (1.4.3)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

Run an automated color contrast check in axe or another tool if you haven't already, and manually validate the automated tool results if necessary, by using the TPGi Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA) or a similar manual color picker. Some examples of text that may pass automated validation and require a manual review are placeholder text within fields, text overlayed on a background image or video, or text within read-only inputs. Disabled controls are exempt from color contrast requirements.

Expected Result

People with low vision and sensitive to colour will have difficulty, due to low contrast ratio.

23/05/2025 14:17 Bug filed on "Pointer - Additional Content on Hover (1.4.13)"
Step no. Result Title

Content that appears on mouse hover may be moved over with a pointer without disappearing. (1.4.13)

3. None

Content that appears on mouse hover or keyboard focus may be dismissed by the user unless the additional content communicates an input error or does not obscure or replace other content (title attribute is excluded). (1.4.13)

23/05/2025 14:40 Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Information, Structure, and Relationship Information is Available (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. None

User navigates page with the screen reader and verifies that list information is either correctly identified by the screen reader or available in text.

Expected Result

Bullets or numbered lists are identified as lists either by the screen reader recognizing them or in the associated text. (1.3.1) Content that is clearly not part of a list is not falsely identified as one. (1.3.1) When a list has been programmatically defined, the screen reader announces the correct number of items in the list (1.3.1) List items that appear in columns are coded as one continuous list and only styled to appear in columns. (1.3.1) The screen reader announces cell content as well as the new column or row header associated to the cell. (1.3.1)

4. Notice the element with role="dialog" does not have an accessible name.

Actual Result:
Missing accessible name for Select Client dialog.

Expected Result
The specified element with role="dialog" or role="alertdialog" has an accessible name.
Use aria-labelledby or aria-label to provide an accessible name to the element.
Whenever possible, the alert text can be marked up as the alert dialog's accessible description using aria-describedby.


23/05/2025 15:06 Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Information, Structure, and Relationship Information is Available (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. None

User navigates page with the screen reader and verifies that list information is either correctly identified by the screen reader or available in text.

Expected Result

Bullets or numbered lists are identified as lists either by the screen reader recognizing them or in the associated text. (1.3.1) Content that is clearly not part of a list is not falsely identified as one. (1.3.1) When a list has been programmatically defined, the screen reader announces the correct number of items in the list (1.3.1) List items that appear in columns are coded as one continuous list and only styled to appear in columns. (1.3.1)

2. Failed

User navigates page with the screen reader using its browse function (up and down arrows for NVDA) and verifies that the screen reader correctly identifies table and grid information

Expected Result

Data tables correctly identified as tables by the screen reader (1.3.1) Data grids are correctly identified as grids by the screen reader (1.3.1) Any HTML tables used for layout have role="presentation". (1.3.1) The number of rows and columns in the table or grid is accurately conveyed to screen reader users. (1.3.1) The screen reader announces cell content as well as the new column or row header associated to the cell. (1.3.1)

3. None

User navigates any sortable table or grid with the screen reader using its browse function (up and down arrows for NVDA) and verifies that the screen reader correctly identifies sort functionality and state

Expected Result

The sorting control is a semantic button, built with <button> element or role="button". (1.3.1) The current sorting state (unsorted, ascending, descending) is conveyed visually and within the code (aria-sort="ascending/descending" attribute applied to the sorted column <th> element). (1.3.1, 4.1.2)

4. None

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that any text with meaningful text decoration (highlighting, strikethrough, insertion, bolding, emphasis, etc) is coded with the appropriate tags (<mark>, <del>, <ins>, <strong>, <em>, etc.) Note that most assistive technology will not announce bolding or italics in its default setting.

Expected Result

Semantic markup identifies emphasized or special text formatting. (1.3.1)

5. None

User navigates page with screen reader or inspects code and verifies that blockquotes are applied to visually blockquoted text

Expected Result

Blockquotes are identified as block quotes by the screen reader so that they are aware that this is quoted content (1.3.1) Blockquotes are not used for content that is not being quoted from another source (1.3.1)

6. Failed

User navigates pages with screen reader and verifies that any other information and relationships that are implied by visual formatting are available to the screen reader

Expected Result

Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text. (1.3.1)

Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 2

Test results:

5/23/2025 6:09 PM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Non-text Content (1.1.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates through any page images or icons with screen reader and verifies that informative and/or functional images have a descriptive text alternative

Expected Result

Informative/functional images (<img>, <svg>) have a descriptive text alternative. (1.1.1) For informative images containing text, where the text is vital content or functions as a label (as in a logo), the text alternative includes the image's text. (1.1.1) Complex images (charts, graphs, maps, etc.) have a text or data table alternative. (1.1.1)

Comments: 
Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open: 
    https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements
  2. Login with your firm's email or valid credentials.
  3. Navigate to and activate "Add New Engagement"
  4. Turn NVDA on. Select a client in step 1 and activate "Next"
  5. In step 2 select "Template" in "Engagement Source", then select SMART Practice Aids in "External integration source" Tab through the page, when the error message appears, navigate back using up arrow, note that the icon is not conveyed. Select "New" in "Engagement source"
  6. Repeat this step for each error message described in the following steps.
  7. Activate "Next" to reach Step 3. Navigate to "Next" note the error messages. Insert a name and select corporate tax.
  8. Activate "Next" to reach Step 4. Select "Fund" in the "Structure*" combobox. Navigate using down arrow. Note that the alert icon under "Mask*" is not conveyed. Select any "Fund Template"
  9. Activate "Next" twice to reach Step 6. Tab through the page when the error message for "Ending*" appears. navigate back using up arrow, note that the icon is not conveyed.

The alert / error icon included in error messages is not conveyed to screen reader users as the icon has no accessible textual equivalent

Expected result: 
Informative images must have a textual equivalent for screen readers.

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Add engagement][4.1.2]: Comboboxes lack name and aria attributes, they are improperly formed with two focusable elements
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 2

Test results:

5/26/2025 2:14 PM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Interface Component Name, Role, and Value (4.1.2)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates page with screen reader and for each interface component, verifies that they know that component's Name, Role, and (if applicable) Value

Expected Result

The role of user interface components (is it a checkbox, radio button, button, link, etc.), the name that describes their purpose/effect (e.g. Save, Submit), and if applicable their current state or value (e.g. Checked, Unchecked) is identified by the screen reader (4.1.2)

Comments: 
Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open: 
    https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements
  2. Login with your firm's email or valid credentials.
  3. Navigate to and activate "Add New Engagement"
  4. Turn NVDA on. Select any client, navigate to "Next" and activate the control.
  5. In step 2 browse the page by pressing tab.
  6. Note that the comboboxes have two focusable elements, they do not provide an accessible name and when an error message is displayed it is not programmatically related to the combobox.
  7. Comboboxes are conveyed as: "combo box  collapsed  opens list
    edit  read only  has auto complete  Enter to expand  selected None"
  8. The expand/collapse buttons are conveyed as: "  button  Enter to expand"
  9. When the listbox is expanded, table is announced.
Note:
This can be reproduced in all the comboboxes within "Add engagement" flow.
  • Step 2: "External integration source", "Engagement Source", and "Template"
  • Step 3: "Engagement type", "PIC", "Vendor", and "Entity"
  • Step 4: "Structure", "Fund template", "Period frequency", and "Current period"
  • Step 6: "Index year"
Actual result:
The comboboxes are formed with a read-only input nested in an element that has role combobox. 
They are not programmatically related to the visual label and a button labeled as "Enter to expand" is unnecessary included in the component.
When an error message is available for the combooxes, the message is not programmatically related to the control.
The listbox expanded by the combobox has aria-labelledby with value "listbox" which does not exist in the DOM.
Also, the listbox has CSS "display: table;" and "table-layout:"fixed;" containing elements with CSS "display: table-row;" which results in "table" being conveyed by NVDA when the first option in the listbox is focused.

Expected result: 
Interactive elements must provide a descriptive name and role, and all the required aria attributes and must be properly formed. Interactive elements must not be nested.

Recommended reading:
https://trten.sharepoint.com/sites/intr-digital-accessibility-coe/SitePages/Select-Custom-Combobox.aspx

Screenshot-2025-05-26T14-13-32.241Z.png

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Add engagement][TR Standard]: Inappropriate focus management and code structure for tab controls in "Assigned staff" (step 3)
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 2

Test results:

5/26/2025 3:50 PM Bug filed on "Keyboard - Support Standard Keyboard Interactions (TR Standard)"
Step no. Result Title


9. Failed

User interacts with a sample of page elements that are using tab panel styling Note: Some sites borrow the tablist visual design for lists of links that bring the user to different pages. An actual tab component does not take the user to different pages when a tab is activated, but instead loads the content on the same screen. Only actual tab components should follow these keyboard behaviors.

Expected Result

Tab lists follow their expected keyboard interaction. (TR Standard) -Tab key moves focus to the currently active tab; pressing the tab key again moves focus to the tab panel -Tab panel opens when active tab receives focus or manually, by pressing Enter or Space on a currently active tab -Arrow keys to move focus to different tabs

Comments: 
Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open: 
    https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements
  2. Login with your firm's email or valid credentials.
  3. Navigate to and activate "Add New Engagement"
  4. Turn NVDA on. Select any client, navigate to "Next" and activate the control.
  5. Navigate to and activate "Next" 
  6. In step 3, tab to and activate the "Select" button (or "Edit" if at least one was previously selected.)
  7. Navigate the page by pressing tab.
  8. Note that the tablist navigation is not as expected. When the user presses the tab control, the focus navigates from "All items" to "Selected items" instead of the tabpanel.
Note:
The tablist navigation is not as expected. When the user presses the tab control, the focus navigates from "All items" to "Selected items" instead of the tabpanel.

Actual result:
Ensure that the tablist focus is properly managed. When pressing tab key, the focus must be placed on the tabpanel. Navigation through tab controls should be done with arrow keys,
The tab group is improperly formed as the <ul> which has the role="tablist" does not contain elements with role="tab" as direct children. They contain <li> elements in which the <buttons role="tab"> are nested.
This causes several issues reported by de Axe DevTool and may affect how ATs process the information.
This can be reproduced throughout all the application in pages with tab controls

Expected result: 
Navigation through tab controls should be done with arrow keys.
<ul> elements must contain <li> elements
Elements with role="tablist" must contain elements with role="tab"

Attachment(s):
Screenshot-2025-05-26T15-49-50.507Z.png
Screenshot-2025-05-26T17-57-14.618Z.png

Test Configuration: Demo AF

Reference links:https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/, https://trten.sharepoint.com/sites/intr-digital-accessibility-coe/SitePages/Accessibility-component-acceptance-criteria.aspx

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Add engagement][1.3.1]: Multiple <h1> in "Add engagement"
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 2

Test results:

5/27/2025 11:19 AM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Headings (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates page with the screen reader by browsing or using heading navigation mode

Expected Result

If visual headings are used, they must be given an appropriate semantic role and level (1.3.1) If semantic headings are used, they are only applied to elements that organize page content or communicate page structure. (1.3.1)

Comments: 
Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open: 
    https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements
  2. Login with your firm's email or valid credentials.
  3. Navigate to and activate "Add New Engagement"
  4. Open DigitalA11y Tublets and activate the "Headings" switch.
  5. Note that titles within the tab controls are marked as <h1> resulting in having multiple <h1> headings in the page.
Actual result:
There are several texts improperly marked as <h1>

Expected result: 
Semantic headings are only applied to elements that organize page content or communicate page structure. If these titles are marked as headings as they will function as content heading, then they should be marked as <h2> instead and only one <h1> should be included on each page, the following headings should follow the same logic and be marked as <h3> instead of <h2>

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Communications][1.3.1]: NVDA is not announcing the associated label for toggle controls
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Communications

Test results:

5/27/2025 12:08 PM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Labels and Instructions are Associated (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates page with screen reader and for each input element verifies that any instructions, labels, and legends are associated with their fields and read correctly by the screen reader

Expected Result

All inputs in a form are programmatically associated with a corresponding descriptive label element. (1.3.1) Additional instructions or “help text” for the input are programmatically associated with the input element. (1.3.1) Short (2-3 word) formatting or helper instructions for the field should be included in the <label> element. (TR Ideal) Longer instructional "help text" for a form field must be associated to the field by setting the <input> aria-describedby attribute to the value of the help text element’s id attribute. If a form element is required and that cannot be assumed from page context, it either includes this information in the label, or has the "required" attribute in its tag. (1.3.1) Groups of form elements, such as radio buttons or checkboxes, are semantically associated with the group description. (1.3.1, 3.3.2)

Comments: 

Test Environment:
Application: Engagement Manager (Communications)
Browser: Chrome
Screen Reader: NVDA

URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5997393/Communications

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the above URL in chrome browser and login with valid credentials.
2. Activate the "communications" link from left navigation.
3. Navigate to the 'create request' dropdown and select 'create new request' control.
4. 'Create client request' screen will appear.
5. Turn on the NVDA and navigate to the toggle button.
5. observe that announcement of NVDA.

Actual Result:
NVDA is not announcing the associated label when the focus lands on toggle controls.

Note:
1. Same issue is observed for the "Set default email reminders" controls below the toggle buttons in same page.
2. Same issue is observed for edit field under Password label after activation of password edit field.

Expected Result:
NVDA should announce the associated label-'Include in roll forward' when the focus lands on toggle controls.

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Communications][1.3.1]: Error message is not programmatically associated with 'days' edit field
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Communications

Test results:

5/27/2025 3:02 PM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Errors are Associated (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User triggers form errors with screen reader and confirms that any errors associated with fields are announced when navigating to that field

Expected Result

Form input errors are programmatically associated with their inputs, either by: (1.3.1) -Placing the error message inside the <label> element and use CSS to position and style it. -Associating the error to the field by adding aria-labelledby to the field element and pointing it to the field level error container ID (IMPORTANT: aria-labelledby needs to point to the field's label, helper text, and error message, ideally in that order). -Errors in grouped fields (checkboxes in a fieldset) are programmatically associated with the group, either by placing the error in the <legend> or including the aria-labelledby attribute. (1.3.1) The error state of a field can be programmatically determined, e.g., aria-invalid="true". (1.3.1, 4.1.2)

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Add engagement][1.3.1]: Error message not related to input or not displayed (steps 2, 3, 4, and 6)
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 2

Test results:

5/27/2025 7:56 PM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Errors are Associated (1.3.1)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User triggers form errors with screen reader and confirms that any errors associated with fields are announced when navigating to that field

Expected Result

Form input errors are programmatically associated with their inputs, either by: (1.3.1) -Placing the error message inside the <label> element and use CSS to position and style it. -Associating the error to the field by adding aria-labelledby to the field element and pointing it to the field level error container ID (IMPORTANT: aria-labelledby needs to point to the field's label, helper text, and error message, ideally in that order). -Errors in grouped fields (checkboxes in a fieldset) are programmatically associated with the group, either by placing the error in the <legend> or including the aria-labelledby attribute. (1.3.1) The error state of a field can be programmatically determined, e.g., aria-invalid="true". (1.3.1, 4.1.2)

Comments: 
Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open: 
    https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements
  2. Login with your firm's email or valid credentials.
  3. Navigate to and activate "Add New Engagement"
  4. Turn NVDA on. Select a client in step 1 and activate "Next"
  5. In step 2 select "Template" in "Engagement Source", then select SMART Practice Aids in "External integration source" Tab through the page, when the error message appears, navigate back, note that the error message is not conveyed when the focus reaches the input with error. Select "New" in the "Engagement source" combobox.
  6. Activate "Next" to reach Step 3. Press tab several times, note that the first inpt has an error message and "Next" is disabled.
  7. Navigate back and note that the error message is not conveyed. Insert a name and navigate to "Next" note it is still disabled and no other error message is present. Select any "Engagement type" activate "Next"
  8. Activate "Next" to reach Step 4. Select "Fund" in the "Structure*" combobox. Navigate using down arrow. Note that an error message appears under "Mask*" and it is not conveyed. Navigate to the input, note it is still not conveyed. Select any "Fund Template"
  9. Activate "Next" twice to reach Step 6. Tab through the page note taht the error message for "Ending*" appears but is not conveyed, navigate back using up arrow, note that the message is not conveyed when reaching the input with error.

Actual result:
The error messages are not announced when they appear and are not programmatically related to inputs.

Expected result: 
Error messages that appear after leaving the form field must be conveyed and be programmatically related to the controls to be conveyed when they receive focus.

Attachment(s):
Screenshot-2025-05-27T19-55-43.602Z.png
Test Configuration: Demo AF

Reference links:https://trten.sharepoint.com/sites/intr-digital-accessibility-coe/SitePages/Form-errors.aspx

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Status][1.4.3]: Color contrast ratio failed for the "status bar" text in the "Workpaper Completion by Individual Sign Off" card under "status dashboard".
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature 10

Test results:

5/28/2025 7:47 AM Bug filed on "Color - Text Contrast (1.4.3)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

Run an automated color contrast check in axe or another tool if you haven't already, and manually validate the automated tool results if necessary, by using the TPGi Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA) or a similar manual color picker. Some examples of text that may pass automated validation and require a manual review are placeholder text within fields, text overlayed on a background image or video, or text within read-only inputs. Disabled controls are exempt from color contrast requirements.

Expected Result

Small Text: Text smaller than 24px (18pt) meets at least 4.5:1 contrast against its background. (1.4.3) Large Text: Text at least 19px (14pt) bold or 24px (18pt) non-bold meets at least 3:1 contrast against its background (1.4.3)

Comments: 

Summary:
The text in the status bar of the "Workpaper Completion by Individual Sign Off" card has insufficient color contrast, making it difficult to read for users with visual impairments.

Test environment:
Chrome Version: 137.0.7151.56 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Test URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/

Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open the above URL and login with valid credentials.
  2. Navigate to the "open engagements" button and invoke it.
  3. Open any engagement from engagements list.
  4. Navigate to the "status" button from the left navigation list and invoke it.
  5. Locate the "Workpaper Completion by Individual Sign Off" card.
  6. Observe the color contrast ratio for the "status bar" text.
Actual results:
CCA (Color Contrast Analysis) failed for the "status bar" text in the "Workpaper Completion by Individual Sign Off" card. The current contrast ratio is below the required 4.5:1 minimum.

Expected results:
Color contrast ratio should be equal to or greater than 4.5:1 for all the text elements.

Attachment:


Test Configuration: Demo AF


Reference links:https://trten.sharepoint.com/sites/intr-digital-accessibility-coe/SitePages/Use-of-Color.aspx

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Trail balance][1.4.11]: Close ("X") icon lacks 3:1 contrast ratio.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature7

Test results:

5/28/2025 8:10 AM Bug filed on "Color - Non-text Contrast of Meaningful or Interactive Graphics (1.4.11)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User reviews the page for any graphical objects that are essential for understanding the content or functionality (e.g. arrows, symbols, graph lines, or any icons that function as standalone links) and checks their color contrast by either inspecting the code or by using the TPGi Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA) or a similar manual color picker.

Expected Result

Icons or graphical elements essential for understanding content continue to meet at least 3:1 contrast against the background when hovered (1.4.11)

Comments: 

Summary: Close ("X") icon does not meet the minimum 3:1 contrast ratio. This may affect users with visual impairments who rely on sufficient contrast to distinguish interactive elements.

Test Environment:
Browser: Chrome version (134.0.6998.89)
Tools: CCA
URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5203/TrialBalances

Background Color: #FFFFFF
Contrast Ratio: 2.8:1

Expected Result:
Close ("X") icon should have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against its background.

URL Tested: Feature7

Test results:

5/28/2025 10:38 AM Bug filed on "Screen Reader - NVDA - Heading Enhancements (TR Standard)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User navigates page with the screen reader and in heading navigation mode

Expected Result

Headings on a page or screen are unique. (TR Standard) The highest heading in the hierarchy (<h1> where possible, or <h2> for modals) describes the purpose of the page or screen. (TR Standard) Headings follow a logical, hierarchical sequence. (TR Standard) -Thomson Reuters recommends, but does not require, that headings do not skip semantic levels at all The panel expand/collapse button for any accordions is wrapped in an <h#> heading element to convey accordion sections. (TR Standard)

Comments: 

Summary: Users who rely on screen reader will find difficulty because two H1 headings are defined in the page.

Test Environment:
Browser: Chrome version (134.0.6998.89)
Screen Reader: NVDA
URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5203/TrialBalances

Two H1 headings are defined in the page.

The page should have a single <h1> heading that accurately represents the main topic or purpose, followed by hierarchical headings (<h2>, <h3>, etc.) as needed.

Title: 508: [Engagement Manager][Trail balance][3.3.2]: Missing Persistent Labels for "Search Accounts" and "Search Description" Fields.
Description: Please see Repro Steps field for bug details.
Repro Steps:
Screen reader: NVDA

URL Tested: Feature7

Test results:

5/28/2025 10:59 AM Bug filed on "Content - Labels are Provided for Inputs (3.3.2)"
Step no. Result Title
1. Failed

User observes the visual labels for form controls, input fields, and form options

Expected Result

All form controls (standard or custom) require visible labels or instructions and/or a graphical label. (3.3.2) Labels are always visible. (3.3.2) Note: Using placeholder text for form field instructions is not recommended.

Comments: 

Summary: The "Search Accounts" and "Search Description" form fields rely solely on placeholder text for labeling. This approach is not accessible because the placeholder text disappears when the field receives focus, leaving users without a visible label.

Test Environment:
Browser: Chrome version (134.0.6998.89)
Screen Reader: NVDA
URL: https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/Angular/#/Engagements/5203/TrialBalances

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the URL -  https://www.engagementmanager.thomsonreuters.com/
2. Login with Valid credentials
3. Engagement manager will be displayed.
4. Navigate to any link and click on it.
5. Activate "Trial Balance" in the left navigation.
6. Activate View -> Balance Definitions.
7. "Balance Definitions" page appears.
8. Activate checkboxes in the table.
9. Then activate "Select" below "Rounding Accounts" headings.
10. "Assign Account" modal appears.
11. Locate the "Search Accounts" and "Search Description" form fields. Observe that only placeholder text is used as labels for these fields.

Actual Result: 
The "Search Accounts" and "Search Description" fields lack persistent labels, relying on placeholder text that disappears upon focus.

Expected Result:
Each form field should have a persistent, visible label that remains available to users regardless of field focus. This ensures that users, including those using screen readers, can always identify the purpose of each field.

Note:  The same issue appears for remaining select buttons below "Rounding Accounts" headings.

Screenshot-2025-05-28T10-59-26.227Z.png
